channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: House prices in Wales rising highest, says Rightmove
item.description: A property website says there has been a 10.9% increase in prices this year.

item.title: Towyn: Sikh education call after man handcuffed over dagger
item.description: His friend says he was humiliated when police were called due to their kirpans.

item.title: Call for Covid vaccination focus on under-30s in Wales
item.description: Nearly 120,000 people under 30 have still not taken up their first vaccine dose.

item.title: Cardiff man, 19, admits raping woman in Bute park
item.description: Tyler Higgins is remanded in custody and is due to be sentenced next month.

item.title: Revamped women's football league revealed
item.description: The Football Association of Wales has announced the restructured women's football pyramid will be known as the Adran Leagues.

item.title: Seven men from south Wales arrested after attack
item.description: A 24-year-old man from Northern Ireland is in a critical but stable condition, police say.

item.title: Huw Edwards considering his future at BBC News at Ten
item.description: The journalist finds nightly news "taxing" and says it's "fair" viewers see a change in presenters.

item.title: Covid-19: Brecon Jazz defends 'careful' reopening
item.description: Some businesses have criticised the scaled-back festival, despite an end to social distancing.

item.title: Covid: Pop-up campsite rules 'harming communities'
item.description: Some living near beauty spots say they are dealing with dangerous traffic and fire pits burning all night.

item.title: Wrexham: Teenager suffers 'serious injuries'
item.description: The 18-year-old was taken to hospital after being attacked near the Morrisons supermarket in the town.

item.title: Covid: Safety fears as face-mask rules 'ignored on Welsh trains'
item.description: Some passengers say they feel unsafe, crammed on trains face-to-face with people not wearing masks.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Rail staff face abuse enforcing mask rules
item.description: Passengers on trains in Wales must still wear a mask, unlike in England where it is only advised.

item.title: Covid-19: How many windows to keep open to cut virus build-up
item.description: Opening four windows at lower speeds and only two on the motorway is best, researchers say.

item.title: Reading: Teacher gets stories published after 46 years
item.description: Keith Godwin used to make up stories for his pupils in the 1970s, now they have been published.

item.title: Covid: Record north Wales visitors after 'challenging' 18 months
item.description: North Wales has experienced a record-breaking summer for visitors, a tourism association says.

item.title: GCSEs: Wales' pupils celebrate as A and A* grades improve again
item.description: A and A* grades made up 28.7% of those awarded, compared with 18.4% when exams were last held in 2019.

item.title: Abercynon Road: Man charged after car crashed into vehicles
item.description: A man, charged with drink driving, will appear before magistrates after several cars were damaged.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Spectators will not be allowed at the Games
item.description: Spectators will not be allowed at Paralympic Games events in Tokyo, organisers confirm.

item.title: Flynn Downes: Facing Swansea boss Russell Martin's style 'like playing Barcelona'
item.description: Flynn Downes believes opponents will not relish playing Russell Martin's Swansea because facing his MK Dons side was "like playing at Camp Nou".

item.title: Olympics and Paralympics: GB athletes to get more government funds in run-up to Paris Games in 2024
item.description: The government will increase its funding of Great Britain's Olympians and Paralympians by £23.4m annually to £77.4m a year to aid preparation for the Paris Games in 2024.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Defending table tennis champion Rob Davies ruled out through injury
item.description: Paralympic table tennis champion Rob Davies will not defend his title at Tokyo 2020 after being ruled out of the Games through injury.

item.title: Christian Doidge: Injured Hibs striker out until at least December
item.description: Hibernian striker Christian Doidge has been ruled out until December at the earliest with an Achilles injury.

item.title: 'Rhy hwyr i wneud dim' am sefyllfa Afghanistan
item.description: Llywodraethau'r gorllewin wedi bod yn "hanner cysgu" medd cyn aelod o bwyllgor materion tramor San Steffan.

item.title: Prisiau tai: Cymru'n gweld y cynnydd uchaf yn y DU
item.description: Yn ôl un gwefan gwerthu tai mae prisiau wedi cynyddu 10.9% eleni, a 2.3% yn y mis diwethaf yn unig.

item.title: Dyn yn pledio'n euog i dreisio menyw ym Mharc Bute Caerdydd
item.description: Bydd Tyler Higgins o ardal Cathays yn cael ei gadw yn y ddalfa nes iddo gael ei ddedfrydu ar 2 Medi.

item.title: Ateb y Galw: Y cerddor Lewys Wyn
item.description: Y cerddor Lewys Wyn sy'n cael ei holi yr wythnos yma

item.title: 'Ailstrwythuro sylweddol' i bêl-droed merched yng Nghymru
item.description: Cymru yw'r wlad gyntaf ym Mhrydain i ddileu'r gair "merched" o enw cynghrair bêl-droed i fenywod.
